snippet: CBS reported Thursday that its first-quarter earnings rose 6 percent as higher licensing fees from the company’s Showtime network helped it overcome an advertising downturn caused by less sports programming.
abstract: CBS reports first-quarter earnings of $468 million, or 78 cents per share, up 6 percent from same period one year earlier; cites higher licensing fees from its Showtime network.
lead_paragraph: CBS reported Thursday that its first-quarter earnings rose 6 percent as higher licensing fees from the company’s Showtime network helped it overcome an advertising downturn caused by less sports programming.

headline.main: CBS Posts 6% Gain in Profit, Benefiting From Showtime
headline.print_headline: CBS Posts 6% Gain in Profit, Benefiting From Showtime
